page.title: 20A TOURISTS VIEW OF ABERAERON
page.content: On first entering Aberaeron I thought it was a very attractive but quiet town. We drove through pretty farmland of green pastures and gently,rolling, wooded hills. The coastal scenery was similar to that found in Cornwall with spectactular views of the coastline of Cardigan Bay. We parked the car by the Harbour and had a very pleasant walk along the quay and promenade. We watched the children hunt for crabs on the pebble beach. On returnng we sampled the famous honey ice cream. We had a good choice of cafes and restaurants for our lunch and all the pubs did bar snacks. After lunch we went to the aquarium,visited the yacht club to admire the various boats and as all tourists, we went to the craft shops to buy souvenirs. On reflection Aberaeron is not quiet but it is unspoilt and worth a visit.
